page.title: 13The Slade
page.content: This is a magnificent avenue of lime trees which start at Hinwick House and flank either side of the road going south towards Harrold. The avenue stretches for over one mile. The trees were originally planted in 1873 by the occupants of Hinwick House. The trees are about 50ft. in height and form a long tunnel effect over the road. The trees are extremely attractive at all times of the year, but are at their most splendid during the Autumn, with their orange and golden leaves. In the spring, the scent from the flowers of the limes is quite heady. These trees are a magnificent featurein the landscape, which it is hoped will never be lost.
